title: How the rich invest: Afterpay's Nicholas Molnar makes a cool $200 million
text:
There are not too many people who can boast a $200 million self-made fortune before they even celebrate their 30th birthday.

The tearaway market success of Afterpay Touch Group has however supercharged the fortunes of its 28-year-old co-founder Nicholas Molnar.

Afterpay is fast becoming the go-to payments platform for Millennial shoppers who want to own products immediately but pay for them in instalments.

Afterpay Touch Group's success is boosting the fortunes of co-founder Nicholas Molnar. James Brickwood

The instalment service is growing rapidly. It has more than 1.8 million customers and is growing at roughly 3300 new customers per day. There are now 14,000 retailers using the service; it will soon be available for buying Jetstar flights and in May announced it was transacting in the US after cutting a deal with retail powerhouse Urban Outfitters.

The potential for growth in the US has been too conservative by investors, according to Goldman Sachs, even though the stock is trading at about 70-times forward earnings. Goldman Sachs has upgraded Afterpay to a buy, saying the US market was 15 times the size of Australia and offered plenty of upside.
description: There are not too many people who who boast a $200 million self-made fortune before they even celebrate their 30th birthday. But Nicholas Molnar is one of them.
